In economics, the Life-Cycle Hypothesis (LCH) is a model that describes how individuals allocate their consumption expenditures over their lifetimes. According to this hypothesis, individuals plan their consumption based on their expected lifetime income, rather than just their current income. This means that people tend to smooth their consumption over time, saving during periods of high income and dis-saving (or borrowing) during periods of low income.
The life cycle is a model that describes the way a typical net worth of person changes over his lifetime and therefore is affected by his/her age. ... The effect of this is ageing is a life cycle effect and it will increase national savings and decrease consumption
